title: Pressing download button makes Start appear, which when pressed, crashes the app
body:
2.1 F-Droid

Steps:
* Install app
* press download button
* press download button a lot of times
* see a Start button popup before the model is downloaded
* press Start

App crashes

App will never start again
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.woheller69.whisper/com.whispertflite.MainActivity}: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: ByteBuffer is not a valid TensorFlow Lite model flatbuffer
	at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3993)
	at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:4180)
	at android.app.servertransaction.LaunchActivityItem.execute(LaunchActivityItem.java:114)
	at android.app.servertransaction.TransactionExecutor.executeNonLifecycleItem(TransactionExecutor.java:231)
	at android.app.servertransaction.TransactionExecutor.executeTransactionItems(TransactionExecutor.java:152)
	at android.app.servertransaction.TransactionExecutor.execute(TransactionExecutor.java:93)
	at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:2595)
	at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:107)
	at android.os.Looper.loopOnce(Looper.java:232)
	at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:317)
	at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:8601)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(RuntimeInit.java:583)
	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:863)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: ByteBuffer is not a valid TensorFlow Lite model flatbuffer
	at org.tensorflow.lite.NativeInterpreterWrapper.createModelWithBuffer(Native Method)
	at org.tensorflow.lite.NativeInterpreterWrapper.<init>(NativeInterpreterWrapper.java:72)
	at org.tensorflow.lite.NativeInterpreterWrapperExperimental.<init>(NativeInterpreterWrapperExperimental.java:36)
	at org.tensorflow.lite.Interpreter.<init>(Interpreter.java:232)
	at com.whispertflite.engine.WhisperEngineJava.loadModel(WhisperEngineJava.java:99)
	at com.whispertflite.engine.WhisperEngineJava.initialize(WhisperEngineJava.java:47)
	at com.whispertflite.asr.Whisper.loadModel(Whisper.java:65)
	at com.whispertflite.asr.Whisper.loadModel(Whisper.java:59)
	at com.whispertflite.MainActivity.initModel(MainActivity.java:230)
	at com.whispertflite.MainActivity.onCreate(MainActivity.java:114)
	at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:8960)
	at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:8938)
	at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1530)
	at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3975)
	... 13 more
```
...until I clean app data
author: licaon-kter

comments.body:
Interesting. The start button appears which should not be the case and it crashes.
But at next start it shows the download screen again. I do not need to clear app data.
At every start the integrity of the model is verified via md5 and it is deleted if wrong...
Will disable download button when download is started

title: Share file for transcript
body:
First of all, thanks for this application. 
For iOS there is an app called AIKO.
This application allows audio to be  longer than 30 seconds. It's also possible to transcripe an audio file, for example a voice message.
You may have a look at this application since it's also open source. Maybe you can find out how to manage the problems regarding to the sample rate and length of audio.
I was waiting for an Android application which allows me to use the whisper model since I know AICO. And the best thing is I can use this application as input method. That's not possible with the iOS application.
author: errotech

comments.body:
duplicate of #15
This is not planned for this app.

title: whisperIME not recognized be Anysoftkeyboard
body:
Dear @woheller69,

whisperIME works really great and reliable. I like the append feature in particular.

When I try to use whisperIME in Anysoftkeyboard ist not recognized as IME. In contrast, Futo is recognized if I push the microphone symbol in Anysoftkeybord. Thus, it might basically work too. I don't know if I am doing any setting wrong.

To be precise: Choosing whisperIME as keyboard works perfectly. Invoking whisperIME via Anysoftkeyboard does currently not work. I haven't tested other keyboards.

Maybe you would like to take a look at this in the future.

Thanks
author: devSJR

comments.body:
Probably a bug in Anysoftkeyboard.
Futo has implemented workarounds for buggy keyboards.
Android finds it, so any keyboard should be able to find it...
I recommend HeliBoard.

title: option to append the transcriptions of back-to-back recordings in the UI before copying the results
body:
Right now every time the user record a new audio, the transcription result "space" start anew, with a blank space.

What about allowing/add a parameter, which selected, would allow to keep the previous recording's transcription and add the next recording's transcription after it ?

In the event of X back-to-back recording the transcription result space would consist of X blocks of text, one for each recording, and be ready to be copy/pasted entirely at once .
author: serpico

comments.body: Check "append"

üòÜ Sorry for the trouble I had the French GUI, and though a native French the translation didn't click in my head, pretty self-explanatory in English but If I'm the first to report this no need to rush and provide a clearer description somewhere in the UI

title: [Bug report] App crashes when starting new recording while previous one is still processing
body:
Hey there! üëã 

First of all, thanks for this awesome app! I wanted to report a bug I encountered while using WhisperIME. Also, if this is a duplicate issue, feel free to close it and point me to the original one - no worries!

**Issue Description:**
When using the push-to-talk feature, if I try to start a new recording while the previous one is still being processed, the app crashes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Press and hold the push-to-talk button
2. Speak for a few seconds
3. Release the button (speech processing starts)
4. While it's still processing, press the button again to start a new recording
‚Üí App crashes

**Additional Note:**
I also noticed the same 30-second limitation mentioned in issue #10 (speech beyond ~30 seconds gets lost without any notification). Just mentioning it here as additional feedback.

---

I'm happy to provide any additional information that might help debug this issue. Just let me know if you need anything else! Thanks for your time! üòä
author: mathe00

comments.body: should be fixed in next version. It will show a message "Please wait" when you press the MIC button before processing is finished.

title: Change of screen orientation wipes recording & transcript
body:
Hi, huge thanks for your work on this app, I've just installed and it seems great.

My screen is usually set to auto-rotate, and if it changes orientation while recording, the current recording is lost, as well as any text already transcribed. Can there be a setting to lock the screen orientation while using the app please?
author: gitrandomuser

comments.body: This should be fixed in the next version.

title: [Feature Request] Audio file import
body:
Hi there! 

Amazing app, it's great to finally have a working offline alternative for voice recognition on Android!

I was wondering if it would be possible to add a feature to import existing audio files? 

It would be handy for:
- Transcribing voice messages received on WhatsApp/Telegram/etc.
- Processing previously recorded voice memos  
- And many other similar use cases

I know this isn't the main purpose of the app which is more IME-focused, but it could be a nice bonus feature for users.

What do you think?

Thanks!
author: mathe00

comments.body:
Duplicate of #8 
Whisper only works for 16kHz mono input. So this would require resampling of audio files

What you can do is open the app in split screen mode, e.g. with WhatsApp.
Play the voice message on WhatsApp in the lower half of the screen and transcribe it with Whisper in the upper half of the screen.
Can't we have audio resampling within the app?

> What you can do is open the app in split screen mode, e.g. with WhatsApp.
> Play the voice message on WhatsApp in the lower half of the screen and transcribe it with Whisper in the upper half of the screen.

I would love the feature to upload audio, it would be a game changer for people that learn languages with podcasts  because you could make a transcript and understand better the language
Not planned

title: How to determine whether it will translate or not?
body:
I installed the version from F-Droid.
As I'm a German speaker I chose the multi-lingual model. 
I noticed that Whisper sometimes translated my spoken words into English (yet in a sensible way). But sometimes it just transcribed my German words to German text. 

It would be nice if I could change the behavior. So it would be nice if there is an option or something like this to switch between translate and transcribe.

Thanks for the great tool.

Pixel 5
/e/OS v2.6.3-t

title: Improvement for screen reader users
body: Hello, first off, I would like to start by saying that this app is very useful for us, but there are some issues. For example, the screen readers cannot read the element names in the UI because they are not properly labeled. Please label them according to the Android accessibility guidelines. Also, there should be some kind of feedback to let us know that the recording has been started. I would like to thank you for this project and hope that it keeps growing.
author: aryanchoudharypro

comments.body: should work in next version. If not, reopen

author: aahmozart

comments.body: see #15

title: [Feature Request] Input Language Selector
body:
Since I work with multiple languages in different scripts, I sometimes need to have text written in it's own language, and sometimes I need it to be transliterated, and since the Whisper model is essentially trying to guess which language is being spoken, it is a Russian roulette as to whether the language recognized is indeed the origin language, a transliteration, or a similar language.

Therefore it would be nice to have a language selector, similar to FUTO's Voice Input, to force it to output to a specific language, which will make the results much more consistent
author: moriel5

comments.body:
Update: Now it thought I was speaking in (I guess) Turkish.
Update 2: Google Translator actually believes that the output was a transliteration to Icelandic.
the tflite model I found does not support that. I hope to find out how to create such a tflite model.

That would be great.
I wonder if what FUTO's Voice Input's developer did may help with inspiration.
